intro: Epilobium × wildtianum, commonly known as the hybrid willow herb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
